title: Godlovesyou
author: Godlovesyou
content: Many altcoins are dumping ground, after the project is launched people invest massively on it, they will carry out a burn and the burn will have no meaningful bulls and then àfter a while the project became dormant like one and only Africa project called "wakanda" I guess many are victims and aware of this falsehood and fake project.Please which altcoin is currently the hotcake with bright future ahead?

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: Godlovesyou on April 14, 2023, 05:03:31 AMMany altcoins are dumping ground, after the project is launched people invest massively on it, they will carry out a burn and the burn will have no meaningful bulls and then àfter a while the project became dormant like one and only Africa project called "wakanda" I guess many are victims and aware of this falsehood and fake project.Please which altcoin is currently the hotcake with bright future ahead?I would say none! Don't try to find gold from muddy water. Nowadays even Chatgpt can create an altcoin for you and provide you with detailed guidance on how to launch that. Do you think they are worthwhile? In altcoin market, the creator of the altcoins are the benefited ones. Rest all loose money while waiting for a better future price. Let's not get into that path. Invest in Bitcoin and ETH, if you are really serious about your money.

comments.body: Quote from: Godlovesyou on April 14, 2023, 05:03:31 AMMany altcoins are dumping ground, after the project is launched people invest massively on it, they will carry out a burn and the burn will have no meaningful bulls and then àfter a while the project became dormant like one and only Africa project called "wakanda" I guess many are victims and aware of this falsehood and fake project.Please which altcoin is currently the hotcake with bright future ahead?This is normal, especially those projects who rely too much with the hype and yet their project itself is not that good.If you are going to invest on a new project, make sure that you are ready for the risk and you know when to take profit because not all new projects are worth to buy. You can consider buying top altcoins instead especially now that there's a good pump for the altcoins market though be cautious as corrections are still possible to happen.

comments.author: JayTrain
comments.body: Certainly, when investing in altcoins, it's important to do your own research and due diligence to mitigate risks. It's also important to have a clear investment strategy and not invest more than you can afford to lose. As for which altcoin has a bright future, it's difficult to say for sure as the market is constantly changing and can be unpredictable. It's important to stay up to date on the latest news and developments in the industry and to make informed investment decisions based on your own research and risk tolerance.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Stay away from altcoins, especially those with famous brands or games, as they will likely be spam."Wakanda" reminds me of the name of the movie of the same name that became somewhat popular so I think scammers always try to exploit famous names.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: The hotcake has been always Bitcoin. Since you are complaining about being a victim of altcoins' scams and falling for false promises, I believe you should go through a safer route with your investments in cryptocurrency, and the safest route is Bitcoin, without any doubts.Otherwise, if you continue playing around with altcoins, in an attempt to be lucky guy to pick the right one that will boost your earnings in x100, x1000 overnight, it's certain you are going to continue falling for such scams over and over again!

As for the devs, some of them abandoned it completely without anything to offer after that initial hype. As for the next hotcake, it's hard to see, I think it will still be P2E and anything about gamers + blockchain technology.

I don't really know why this happens that often because none of those projects that i observed that slowly died were useless meme-coins some of them were even pretty good in my opinion.I think that a big part of the problem is the mentality of the investors. It is all about a quick pump and dump for most people. If a project does not do a x2 or more right after listing then it is already a fail in the eyes of a lot of people, because they don't have patience anymore.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Most of these tokens lack use-cases and they are created by project owners to enrich themselves and call channels. They will create a token and reach out to callers promote the token in their channels, the moment the token pumps to a particular price they will dumb it and go over to the next project. My advice is to stay away from pump and dump projects and always do due diligence before you invest your funds in any project.

comments.author: Luffygroove
comments.body: Okay, since you asked about the new altcoin project that probably has a bright future, I would say Biokript. Biokript is the first syariah-compliant hybrid exchange that combines the advantages of CEX and DEX and eliminates the inefficiencies of both exchanges. Shariah-compliant means they don't have trading features like futures trading or staking that actually violate Islamic finance practises. On the other hand, they execute 50/50 profit sharing for their investors and token holders, called the Mudarabah principle. It hasn't been launched because they have a commitment to actually release the product first (which is the exchange) before doing some fund-raising. They planned to do a presale and, right after that, a public listing on Uniswap and Pancakeswap (and, of course, on their own exchange). They just announced a partnership with another project called Melega Swap. I think Biokript is one of the rare new projects out there that decides to make their concept a real product first instead of just selling their concept alone. For me, it shows good intention, a pure heart, and seriousness, which is why I'm looking forward to the presale.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: There are hundreds of not thousands of these dead projects. Basically as soon as there are no bids at 1 sat for the token or it’s delisted from every exchange you can say it’s good as dead.Not all dead projects were scams but they just weren’t marketed correctly. These days it’s all about the amount of money you put towards marketing your tokens to determine how it will perform in the future. Many projects just couldn’t afford the proper ads and just died off.
